member.name: N:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document
member.summary: Namespace where all Advanced Document Cleanup Commands are located.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand

remarks.para: Unlike AutoBorderCropCommand, black border pixels will be turned to white instead of being cropped off.
This command also differs from the BorderRemovalCommand included with DotImage Document Imaging, which is a simpler version of AutoBorderCropCommand.

member.summary: Automatically removes black borders from a bi-tonal image using a sophisticated object detection algorithm.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand.MinBorderThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum border thickness, in pixels, that will be removed.
member.remarks: Default value is 5.
member.exception: Raised when value is less than 1.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand.MinBorderThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum border thickness, in pixels, that will be removed.
member.remarks: Default value is 5.
member.exception: Raised when value is less than 1.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand.MaxBorderThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum border thickness, in pixels, that will be removed.
member.remarks: Default value is 50.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand.MaxBorderThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum border thickness, in pixels, that will be removed.
member.remarks: Default value is 50.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand.Denoise
member.summary: When true, will denoise the image prior to detecting the border.
member.remarks: Default value is false. When set to true, there is a lower chance of removing useful data when the image is highly noised.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand.Denoise
member.summary: When true, will denoise the image prior to detecting the border.
member.remarks: Default value is false. When set to true, there is a lower chance of removing useful data when the image is highly noised.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand.TextThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the average text thickness in pixels, which affects object detection quality.
member.remarks: This property is auto configurable. It will have no effect on the image if AutoPropertyConfigurationEnabled is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand.TextThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the average text thickness in pixels, which affects object detection quality.
member.remarks: This property is auto configurable. It will have no effect on the image if AutoPropertyConfigurationEnabled is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand.SpeedFactor
member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Fast.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand.SpeedFactor
member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Fast.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand.AutoPropertyConfigurationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if properties in the AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand.PropertiesToAutoConfigure property will be automatically determined by the command when processed.
member.remarks: Set this to false when hand tweaking auto configurable properties. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand.AutoPropertyConfigurationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if properties in the AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand.PropertiesToAutoConfigure property will be automatically determined by the command when processed.
member.remarks: Set this to false when hand tweaking auto configurable properties. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand.SupportedPixelFormats
member.summary: Gets a list of PixelFormats that this command will support without throwing an exception. This command supports Pixel1bppIndexed only.

member.name: N:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document
member.summary: Namespace where all Advanced Document Cleanup Commands are located.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeMethod
member.summary: Lists the supported binarization methods used in the BinarizeCommand

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeMethod.SimpleThreshold
member.summary: Simple, fast thresholding with level determined by user.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeMethod.GlobalThreshold
member.summary: Threshold level determined from entire image. Useful for removing shaded regions, but could remove light colored content such as watermarks.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeMethod.AdaptiveThreshold
member.summary: Adapts to surrounding pixels, highlights subtle changes in intensity. Most forgiving thresholding method but can produce noisy images.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeMethod.DynamicThreshold
member.summary: Dynamically adapts to surrounding pixels, highlights subtle changes in intensity. More faithful to large dark areas.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeCommand
member.summary: Converts a grayscale or color image to black and white using one of the available Binarize methods.

member.name: O:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeCommand._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of BinarizeCommand.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeCommand._ctor(BinarizeMethod)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of BinarizeCommand specifying the binarization method.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeCommand.BinarizationMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the type of binarization to use.
member.remarks: Default value is AdaptiveThreshold.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeCommand.BinarizationMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the type of binarization to use.
member.remarks: Default value is AdaptiveThreshold.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeCommand.ThresholdDifferencing
member.summary: Gets or sets the thresholding differencing used for the AdaptiveThreshold method.
member.remarks: Default is 7.
member.exception: Throws when value is less than 1 or greater than 255.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeCommand.ThresholdDifferencing
member.summary: Gets or sets the thresholding differencing used for the AdaptiveThreshold method.
member.remarks: Default is 7.
member.exception: Throws when value is less than 1 or greater than 255.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeCommand.InitialThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the seed threshold value to use for GlobalThreshold and the actual threshold value to use for SimpleThreshold methods.
member.remarks: Default value is 127.
member.exception: Throws when value is less than 1 or greater than 255.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeCommand.InitialThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the seed threshold value to use for GlobalThreshold and the actual threshold value to use for SimpleThreshold methods.
member.remarks: Default value is 127.
member.exception: Throws when value is less than 1 or greater than 255.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeCommand.BlackGrouping
member.summary: A percentile indication of how tightly grouped black pixels need to be.
member.remarks: A value from 0 to 1. Default is 0.25. 0.4 is roughly equivalent to the AdaptiveThresholding command

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeCommand.BlackGrouping
member.summary: A percentile indication of how tightly grouped black pixels need to be.
member.remarks: A value from 0 to 1. Default is 0.25. 0.4 is roughly equivalent to the AdaptiveThresholding command

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BinarizeCommand.SupportedPixelFormats
member.summary: Gets a list of PixelFormats that this command will support without throwing an exception. This command supports all continuous tone pixel formats.

member.name: N:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document
member.summary: Namespace where all Advanced Document Cleanup Commands are located.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropCommand
member.summary: Crops black borders from the edges of a bi-tonal image.

remarks.para: Similar to AdvancedBorderRemovalCommand, but crops the image as opposed to making the border white. This command is much faster than AdvancedBorderRemoval.
Uses a more advanced algorithm than AutoCropCommand and BorderRemovalCommand included with DotImage Document Imaging.
When applying this command, the resulting ImageResults is an instance of AutoBorderCropResults containing the coordinates of the detected border.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropCommand._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of AutoBorderCropCommand.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropCommand.MaxBoundaryWhitespace
member.summary: The maximum amount of white space in pixels from the edge of the image to the start of the border.
member.remarks: Default value is 16.
member.exception: Thrown when value is less than 0.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropCommand.MaxBoundaryWhitespace
member.summary: The maximum amount of white space in pixels from the edge of the image to the start of the border.
member.remarks: Default value is 16.
member.exception: Thrown when value is less than 0.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropCommand.BorderNoiseTolerance

summary.para: The acceptable percentage of white pixel "noise" within the black border area.

member.remarks: Valid values are from 0 to 1, with default of 0.15. A value of 0 indicates zero tolerance for noise where the entire border must be completely black.
member.exception: Thrown when value is less than 0 or greater than 1.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropCommand.BorderNoiseTolerance

summary.para: The acceptable percentage of white pixel "noise" within the black border area.

member.remarks: Valid values are from 0 to 1, with default of 0.15. A value of 0 indicates zero tolerance for noise where the entire border must be completely black.
member.exception: Thrown when value is less than 0 or greater than 1.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropCommand.BorderStreakTolerance

summary.para: The acceptable percentage of white streaks within the black border area.

member.remarks: A "streak" is a solid white scanline when inspecting the border area. A set of white streaks with its thickness less than a number of MaxBorderThickness * StreakTolerance will be considered a part of the black border. Valid values are from 0 to 1, with a default value of 0.1.
member.exception: Thrown when value is less than 0 or greater than 1.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropCommand.BorderStreakTolerance

summary.para: The acceptable percentage of white streaks within the black border area.

member.remarks: A "streak" is a solid white scanline when inspecting the border area. A set of white streaks with its thickness less than a number of MaxBorderThickness * StreakTolerance will be considered a part of the black border. Valid values are from 0 to 1, with a default value of 0.1.
member.exception: Thrown when value is less than 0 or greater than 1.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropCommand.MaxBorderThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum border thickness, in pixels, that will be removed.
member.remarks: Default value is 60. The algorithm will only scan lines that are within this many pixels from the edge of the image.
member.exception: Thrown when value is less than 1.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropCommand.MaxBorderThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum border thickness, in pixels, that will be removed.
member.remarks: Default value is 60. The algorithm will only scan lines that are within this many pixels from the edge of the image.
member.exception: Thrown when value is less than 1.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropCommand.SpeedFactor
member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Normal.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropCommand.SpeedFactor
member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Normal.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropCommand.SupportedPixelFormats
member.summary: Gets a list of PixelFormats that this command will support without throwing an exception. This command supports Pixel1bppIndexed only.

member.name: N:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document
member.summary: Namespace where all Advanced Document Cleanup Commands are located.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropResults
member.summary: Provides custom ImageResults for AutoBorderCropCommand.

member.name: O:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropResults._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of AutoBorderCropResults.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropResults._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of AutoBorderCropResults.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropResults._ctor(Rectangle)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of AutoBorderCropResults specifying the boundary coordinates.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoBorderCropResults.BorderRectangle
member.summary: Gets the rectangular coordinates of the detected border.

member.name: N:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document
member.summary: Namespace where all Advanced Document Cleanup Commands are located.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoInvertTextCommand

summary.para: Automatically inverts regions of text that are inverted (white on black) on a bi-tonal image.

member.remarks: This command is useful when pre-processing documents prior to OCR, as many OCR engines do not recognize inverted text areas.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoInvertTextCommand._ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of AutoInverseTextCorrectionCommand.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoInvertTextCommand.AutoPropertyConfigurationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if properties in the PropertiesToAutoConfigure property will be automatically determined by the command when processed.
member.remarks: Set this to false when hand tweaking auto configurable properties. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoInvertTextCommand.AutoPropertyConfigurationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if properties in the PropertiesToAutoConfigure property will be automatically determined by the command when processed.
member.remarks: Set this to false when hand tweaking auto configurable properties. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoInvertTextCommand.PropertiesToAutoConfigure
member.summary: Gets a collection of property names that will be auto configured when AutoPropertyConfigurationEnabled is true.
member.remarks: This collection can be modified by adding or removing property names to be auto configured. Properties must have the AutoConfigurableAttribute to be added to this collection. All AutoConfigurable properties are added to this collection by default including InvertedRegionSizeMinimum, InvertedRegionSizeMaximum, and TextThickness.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoInvertTextCommand.InvertedRegionSizeMinimum
member.summary: Minimum size limit of of inverted text region in pixels.
member.remarks: Auto configurable. Default size is 40, 40.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoInvertTextCommand.InvertedRegionSizeMinimum
member.summary: Minimum size limit of of inverted text region in pixels.
member.remarks: Auto configurable. Default size is 40, 40.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoInvertTextCommand.InvertedRegionSizeMaximum
member.summary: Maximum size in pixels of the inverted text region.
member.remarks: Auto configurable. Default value is 400, 400.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoInvertTextCommand.InvertedRegionSizeMaximum
member.summary: Maximum size in pixels of the inverted text region.
member.remarks: Auto configurable. Default value is 400, 400.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoInvertTextCommand.SupportedPixelFormats
member.summary: Gets a list of PixelFormats that this command will support without throwing an exception. This command supports Pixel1bppIndexed only.

member.name: N:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document
member.summary: Namespace where all Advanced Document Cleanup Commands are located.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.MarginCropCommand
member.summary: Crops excess white borders from a bi-tonal image.

remarks.para: When scanned images contain large white borders or margins, this will automatically crop the image leaving only the interesting document features.
When applying this command, the resulting ImageResults is an instance of MarginCropResults containing the margin boundary.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.MarginCropCommand._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of MarginCropCommand.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.MarginCropCommand.Denoise
member.summary: When true, will remove noise before detecting the margin.
member.remarks: Default value is false.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.MarginCropCommand.Denoise
member.summary: When true, will remove noise before detecting the margin.
member.remarks: Default value is false.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.MarginCropCommand.SpeedFactor
member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Fast.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.MarginCropCommand.SpeedFactor
member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Fast.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.MarginCropCommand.SupportedPixelFormats
member.summary: Gets a list of PixelFormats that this command will support without throwing an exception. This command supports Pixel1bppIndexed only.

member.summary: Namespace where all Advanced Document Cleanup Commands are located.

member.summary: Provides custom ImageResults for MarginCropCommand.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of MarginCropResults.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of MarginCropResults given the border rectangle.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoNegateCommand
member.summary: Inspects an bi-tonal image to determine if the image is negated. Will automatically invert the image if InvertWhenWhiteOnBlack.

remarks.para: When applying this command, the resulting ImageResults is an instance of AutoNegateResults containing a boolean IsInverted property.

member.name: O:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoNegateCommand._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of AutoNegateCommand.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoNegateCommand._ctor(Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of AutoNegateCommand specifying if the command should invert the image, or just report results.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoNegateCommand.InvertWhenWhiteOnBlack
member.summary: When true will automatically invert the image when the resulting IsInverted property is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoNegateCommand.InvertWhenWhiteOnBlack
member.summary: When true will automatically invert the image when the resulting IsInverted property is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoNegateCommand.SpeedFactor
member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Normal.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoNegateCommand.SpeedFactor
member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Normal.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoNegateCommand.SupportedPixelFormats
member.summary: Gets a list of PixelFormats that this command will support without throwing an exception. This command supports Pixel1bppIndexed only.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.AutoNegateCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Returns true because this command will process the image in-place and not allocate a new block of memory.

member.name: N:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document
member.summary: Namespace where all Advanced Document Cleanup Commands are located.

member.summary: Provides a custom ImageResults for the AutoNegateCommand.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of AutoNegateResults.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of AutoNegateResults specifying the value of IsInverted.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the given image is inverted (White on Black).

member.summary: Namespace where all Advanced Document Cleanup Commands are located.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlankPageDetectionCommand
member.summary: Detect whether a given image (or a region of interest in the image) is blank.

remarks.para: A custom ImageResults is returned called BlankPageDetectionResults with the property IsImageBlank. Use this property to determine if the image is blank or not.

Note that this command supports bitonal images only, however it can be used with color images as well by setting ApplyToAnyPixelFormat to true. When doing this, be sure to set the DefaultPixelFormatChanger to one that uses a Document Thresholding method.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlankPageDetectionCommand._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of BlankPageDetectionCommand.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlankPageDetectionCommand.RemoveBorder
member.summary: Will remove black borders in the image prior to detecting blank page when true.
member.remarks: Default value is false.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlankPageDetectionCommand.RemoveBorder
member.summary: Will remove black borders in the image prior to detecting blank page when true.
member.remarks: Default value is false.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlankPageDetectionCommand.Denoise
member.summary: Will remove noise in the image prior to detecting blank page when true.
member.remarks: Default value is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlankPageDetectionCommand.Denoise
member.summary: Will remove noise in the image prior to detecting blank page when true.
member.remarks: Default value is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlankPageDetectionCommand.MinObjectSize

summary.para: Objects that are smaller than this size will be ignored when detecting blank pages.

member.remarks: Default value is (10, 20).

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlankPageDetectionCommand.MinObjectSize

summary.para: Objects that are smaller than this size will be ignored when detecting blank pages.

member.remarks: Default value is (10, 20).

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlankPageDetectionCommand.InPlaceProcessing
member.summary: Returns true because this command doesn't actually return a new image, just returns the source image.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlankPageDetectionCommand.TextThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the average text thickness in pixels, which affects object detection quality.
member.remarks: This property is auto configurable. It will have no effect on the image if AutoPropertyConfigurationEnabled is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlankPageDetectionCommand.TextThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the average text thickness in pixels, which affects object detection quality.
member.remarks: This property is auto configurable. It will have no effect on the image if AutoPropertyConfigurationEnabled is true.

member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Fast.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlankPageDetectionCommand.SpeedFactor
member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Fast.

member.summary: Gets a list of PixelFormats that this command will support without throwing an exception. This command supports Pixel1bppIndexed only.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlobRemovalCommand
member.summary: A generic object removal command for bi-tonal images.

remarks.para: Objects of which sizes are between minium and maximum user-input size will be removed out of a given image.
Other commands such as HolePunchRemovalCommand are specialized versions of BlobRemovalCommand.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlobRemovalCommand._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of BlobRemovalCommand.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlobRemovalCommand.MinObjectSize
member.summary: Minimum size of the object to remove.
member.remarks: An object is a set of connected pixels.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlobRemovalCommand.MinObjectSize
member.summary: Minimum size of the object to remove.
member.remarks: An object is a set of connected pixels.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlobRemovalCommand.SpeedFactor
member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Normal.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlobRemovalCommand.SpeedFactor
member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Normal.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlobRemovalCommand.SupportedPixelFormats
member.summary: Gets a list of PixelFormats that this command will support without throwing an exception. This command supports Pixel1bppIndexed only.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlobRemovalCommand.TextThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the average text thickness in pixels, which affects object detection quality.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.BlobRemovalCommand.TextThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the average text thickness in pixels, which affects object detection quality.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand
member.summary: This command detects color regions from a color document resulting in an image with grayscale and bi-tonal areas masked with transparent alpha, and notification if the document contains any color.

remarks.para: This command is very useful for scanning documents as color, and automatically detecting when a document has no color so that it can be converted to black and white for better compression. The Apply method will result in an instance of ColorExtractionResults that contains a ColorExtractionResults.HasColor property. When HasColor is false, the document has only gray shades and can be converted to black and white with little to no loss in quality. When HasColor is true, it generally means that the document has color regions and that it should remain a color document to retain this color information.

The resulting Image in ColorExtractionResults is always a 32-bit BGRA with a transparent alpha channel masking the non-color areas. When no color is detected the resulting Image is a 1x1 pixel transparent image.

There are two distinct types of color areas in a document. A color marking can be a highlight region, red pen, or other solid colors. A photo region is an area with a lot of visual activity usually represented in a color or grayscale photograph. This command has the ability to detect color markings, photos, or both.

The default values are optimized for detecting color in scanned documents. By adjusting GrayscaleTolerance to a higher level, this command can be used for other purposes such as detecting grayscale or color magazine scans.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of ColorExtractionCommand.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.SpeedFactor
member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Faster.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.SpeedFactor
member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Faster.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.VisualActivityWindowSize
member.summary: Specifies the masking window for estimating visual color activity used in photo region detection.
member.remarks: Default value is 3.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.VisualActivityWindowSize
member.summary: Specifies the masking window for estimating visual color activity used in photo region detection.
member.remarks: Default value is 3.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.MinPhotoSize
member.summary: Minimum size limit of photo regions in pixels.
member.remarks: Default value is (100, 100).

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.MinPhotoSize
member.summary: Minimum size limit of photo regions in pixels.
member.remarks: Default value is (100, 100).

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.MinMarkingSize
member.summary: Minimum size limit of color markings in pixels.
member.remarks: Default value is (10,10).

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.MinMarkingSize
member.summary: Minimum size limit of color markings in pixels.
member.remarks: Default value is (10,10).

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.DetectColorMarkings
member.summary: When true, color markings will be detected.
member.remarks: A color marking can be a highlight region, red pen, or other solid colors. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.DetectColorMarkings
member.summary: When true, color markings will be detected.
member.remarks: A color marking can be a highlight region, red pen, or other solid colors. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.DetectPhotos
member.summary: When true, color and gray photos will be detected.
member.remarks: A photo region is an area with a lot of visual activity usually represented in a color or grayscale photograph. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.DetectPhotos
member.summary: When true, color and gray photos will be detected.
member.remarks: A photo region is an area with a lot of visual activity usually represented in a color or grayscale photograph. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.VisualActivityThreshold
member.summary: Controls the percentage of entropy threshold that factors in the photo detection algoithm.
member.remarks: Valid values are from 0 to 1.0 with a default of 0.2.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.VisualActivityThreshold
member.summary: Controls the percentage of entropy threshold that factors in the photo detection algoithm.
member.remarks: Valid values are from 0 to 1.0 with a default of 0.2.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.GrayscaleSaturation
member.summary: This value controls the saturation threshold where a saturation less than the given value will be regarded as gray.
member.remarks: Valid values are from 0 to 1.0, with a default of 0.2.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.GrayscaleSaturation
member.summary: This value controls the saturation threshold where a saturation less than the given value will be regarded as gray.
member.remarks: Valid values are from 0 to 1.0, with a default of 0.2.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.GrayscaleTolerance
member.summary: This value controls the amount in percent that any given pixel color is off of pure gray.
member.remarks: The higher the value, the more sensitive the command is to color. Lower values reduces color sensitivity. Valid values are from 0 to 1.0 with a default value of 0.036.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.GrayscaleTolerance
member.summary: This value controls the amount in percent that any given pixel color is off of pure gray.
member.remarks: The higher the value, the more sensitive the command is to color. Lower values reduces color sensitivity. Valid values are from 0 to 1.0 with a default value of 0.036.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.ColorExtractionCommand.SupportedPixelFormats
member.summary: Gets a list of PixelFormats that this command will support without throwing an exception. This command supports color images only.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.HalftoneRemovalCommand
member.summary: Detects and removes shaded regions from bi-tonal images.

remarks.para: Halftone removal is designed for regions that originate as shaded color or grayscale areas that when thresholded to black and white, end up with a halftone texture. OCR engines generally cannot recognize text that is surrounded by halftoning. This command can be used as pre-processing prior to OCR for improved OCR accuracy.
When applying this command, the resulting ImageResults is an instance of HalftoneRemovalResults containing the rectangular boundary of each detected halftone region.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.HalftoneRemovalCommand._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of HalftoneRemovalCommand.

member.summary: The minimum region size that will be detected as halftone.
member.remarks: Default value is 100, 20.

member.summary: The minimum region size that will be detected as halftone.
member.remarks: Default value is 100, 20.

remarks.para: When applying this command, the resulting ImageResults is an instance of HolePunchRemovalResults containing the rectangular boundary of each detected hole punch.

member.summary: The location of hole punches on the image (Left, Top, Right, Bottom).
member.remarks: Default value is Left. ImageEdges can be or'ed together for the algorithm to search more than one edge.

member.summary: The location of hole punches on the image (Left, Top, Right, Bottom).

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand
member.summary: This class removes horizontal and/or vertical lines in a bi-tonal image.

remarks.para: When applying this command, the resulting ImageResults is an instance of LineRemovalResults containing the start point, end point, and thickness of each detected line.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of LineRemovalCommand.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.ReconnectBrokenCharacters
member.summary: When true, reconnects characters that are damaged when intersecting a line that is removed.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.ReconnectBrokenCharacters
member.summary: When true, reconnects characters that are damaged when intersecting a line that is removed.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.MinLineLength
member.summary: Minimum size limit of the lines to be removed in pixels.
member.remarks: Default value is (100, 100).

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.MinLineLength
member.summary: Minimum size limit of the lines to be removed in pixels.
member.remarks: Default value is (100, 100).

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.MaxLineGap
member.summary: Lines detected will have a gap no greater than this value in pixels.
member.remarks: Default value is 20. A value greater than 20 will remove broken lines.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.MaxLineGap
member.summary: Lines detected will have a gap no greater than this value in pixels.
member.remarks: Default value is 20. A value greater than 20 will remove broken lines.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.AngleTolerance
member.summary: The tolerance in degrees offset from vertical or horizontal.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.AngleTolerance
member.summary: The tolerance in degrees offset from vertical or horizontal.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.MinLineThickness
member.summary: Minimum thickness in pixels of the line to be removed.
member.remarks: Default value is 0.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.MinLineThickness
member.summary: Minimum thickness in pixels of the line to be removed.
member.remarks: Default value is 0.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.MaxLineThickness
member.summary: Maximum thickness in pixels of the line to be removed.
member.remarks: Default value is 14.

member.summary: Maximum thickness in pixels of the line to be removed.
member.remarks: Default value is 14.

member.summary: Orientation of the line to be removed: horizontal, vertical, or both.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.Orientation
member.summary: Orientation of the line to be removed: horizontal, vertical, or both.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.TextThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the average text thickness in pixels, which affects object detection quality.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.TextThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the average text thickness in pixels, which affects object detection quality.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.SpeedFactor
member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Normal.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.SpeedFactor
member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Normal.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.LineRemovalCommand.SupportedPixelFormats
member.summary: Gets a list of PixelFormats that this command will support without throwing an exception. This command supports Pixel1bppIndexed only.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.ImageProcessing.Document.SpeckRemovalCommand.SpeedFactor
member.summary: Determines the sample size of the image to process, affecting quality and speed.
member.remarks: This algorithm will resample the source image by 1 (Normal), 1/2 (Fast), 1/4 (Faster), or 1/8 (Fastest) prior to object detection. This setting can can heavily influence performance, sometimes at the expense of quality. Default value is Normal.
